discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Agree, NX-API is a RESTful API that allows retrieving various information, including routing data, from the switches, responses are typically formatted in JSON or XML.

Selected Answer: C
SNMP uses the polling method, which requests information each time information is acquired, but Telemetry uses the subscription method. Regarding transport, SNMP is a UDP-only implementation, but Telemetry uses gRPC in addition to UDP/TCP and uses a flow-controlled transport layer. SNMP uses ASN.
However, The NX-API CLI is a web interface through which commands traditionally entered via the CLI, can be encoded using either XML or JSON, and transmitted via HTTP or a secure transport (HTTPS) to the device. The commands are executed on-box and responses are returned in either XML or JSON format

questions.question_text:
An engineer seeks a solution to retrieve routing information from Cisco Nexus switches. The data must be exported to a web application in a JSON or XML data format for monitoring and must be encrypted during transmission. The solution must not require extensive knowledge to support and should be simple to implement.

Which technology accomplishes these goals?

A network engineer is using a Cisco UCS environment connected to a Fibre Channel storage array. The Cisco UCS environment must be connected to an existing SAN network, and several Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switches must be added to increase storage density. The solution must not exhaust the SAN network from the list of available domain IDs after connecting. Also, most of the SAN traffic must be mapped from the Cisco UCS blades to a specific group of the fabric interconnect ports. Which two features must be deployed to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I think I'm gonna go with B and C also. Pinning is required for the requirement >>> "most of the SAN traffic must be mapped from the Cisco UCS blades to a specific group of the fabric interconnect ports"
End host mode should handle Domain ID exhaustion.

Selected Answer: B
B. end host mode ("The solution must not exhaust the SAN network from the list of available domain IDs after connecting.
C. static PIN grouping ("most of the SAN traffic must be mapped from the Cisco UCS blades to a specific group of the fabric interconnect ports"
So, "B"& "C" are the correct answers.

comments.content: Actually, the option "D" doesn't align with this requirement: "most of the SAN traffic must be mapped from the Cisco UCS blades to a specific group of the fabric interconnect ports"

discussion.content:
The correct answers are:

B. End Host Mode: End Host Mode is essential because it allows the Cisco UCS fabric interconnects to behave as end-host devices, conserving domain IDs and facilitating the control of traffic flow from UCS blades to the SAN. This ensures efficient utilization of domain IDs and simplifies management.

D. N-Port ID Virtualization (NPIV): NPIV is crucial for allowing multiple N-Port WWNs to share a single physical port on the Fibre Channel switch. It enables each UCS blade to have its unique WWN and independently log in to the SAN fabric without the need for a separate physical port for each blade. This addresses the requirement to map SAN traffic from UCS blades to specific fabric interconnect ports while conserving domain IDs.

These two options (B and D) are the correct answers because they directly align with the requirements mentioned in the question, ensuring efficient use of SAN resources and control over UCS blade traffic.

questions.question_text:
Which element is the main functional component of the architecture that separates the internal fabric and the external network that connects sites when VXLAN
EVPN is deployed multisite?

discussion.content: Ethernet VPN (EVPN) which is used as the overlay control plane and provides virtual connectivity between different layer 2/3 domains over an IP or MPLS network. Virtual extensible LANs (VXLAN), a common network virtualization overlay protocol that expands the layer 2 network address space from 4,000 to 16 million.

Selected Answer: C
The main functional component of the EVPN Multi-Site architecture is the border gateway, or BGW. BGWs separate the fabric-side (site-internal fabric) from the network that interconnects the sites (site-external DCI) and mask the site-internal VTEPs.
link:https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/switches/nexus-9000-series-switches/white-paper-c11-739942.html

questions.question_text: An engineer must design a disaster recovery solution for a Cisco ACI Multi-Site network. One requirement is that the applications must have seamless IP addressing across sites. The solution must also be highly resilient and support Layer 2 adjacency. Which design meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This should be B
I'll go with B, Yes BD is needed for seamless addressing but the requirement also states the need to support Layer 2 adjacency, which means stretched L2 broadcast is also required.

Selected Answer: D
You need a stretched BD to have seamless IP addressing across sites

choices.C:
localized bridge domain with local subnet
localized Layer 2 broadcast flooding
choices.D:
stretched bridge domain, subnet, and EPG

localized bridge domain, subnet, and EPG
stretched Layer 2 broadcast domain
choices.B:
